reviews.review: very lovely game, specially the different gamemodes, and the most favorite for myself is the zombie escape mod ^^

Counter-Strike: Source is another game that you will be terrible at to begin with; it's only after you put some time into learning the physics of the world, the recoil and reload speeds of the weapons, and the weight of grenades that you start to improve.
Although an outdated version of Counter-Strike now (succeeded by Counter-Strike: Global Offensive), many players still prefer CS:S, and the community for the game remains strong. However, I would not recommend playing this game as preparation or experience for CS:GO; if you want to play the most updated version of the game, then buy it.
It's also needless to say that Counter-Strike: Source is multiplayer only.

TL;DR: The game is fun, but outdated; you should probably buy Counter-Strike: Global Offensive instead. If possible, buy both, and see which game you prefer.
Love this game so much! Buy it now.

CS:Source is a much loved sequel to counter strike 1.6. Although now it's showing it's age and I don't think I can justify the still significant price tag, Source has a very old and ages community, with a plethora of well thoughtout and funny mods that are available to play free of charge. I Think I've probably spent a large portion of my time actually playing the minigames and zombie survival.

8.7/10
if you play this game you are gay or brazil.
Its a very fun game that is based on a classic formula that will never get old.

Counter-Strike: Source is a great game for people of all ages there is something for everybody in this game, You can play regular source, being Bomb defuse mission or Hostage mission. Or you could play Minigames being Death run, knife fights, Bhop, Jail Break, and many others. I would highly reccoment CSS to anyone who enjoys games made on the Half Life 2 engine. The communities are also very nice (from my expiriences, I've made a lot of good friends and had some great laughs). Also if you buy this game and try it and say "what the hell was he saying this game is Impossible" I had that same reaction when I bought this game I couldn't kill anyone everyone was dominating me and I just seemed to be getting more upset every minute I played. But after playing wth different groups of people and asking for advice I figured out what I was doing wrong and got better everyday. So take my word when I say don't give up this game is fun after you get some practice in.

I would give this game a solid 10 Deagles out of 10.

An addicting and frustrating experience. This game runs great on less powerful machines. It's basically the same game as Counter-Strike GO and runs smoother.

What a game. I got this about a year ago, but only started playing properly a few months ago. It might take some time to adjust to this game, but then you do, you'll have a blast. Something about this game is just so addictive, I've been playing all of my other game less and less, and this more and more. It has a huge playerbase, and I don't see it depleting anytime soon. Pretty sure I'm going to get Counter-Strike: Global Operative on account of how much fun I had with this game. An absolute must have for any Steam gamer!

I was never a Counter-Strike guy.  I played it a few times back when it was a Half-Life mod.  I don't remember how I got Counter-Strike Source.  I think that I bought it but I don't know why.  I played it a few times with bots which was kind of fun but nothing amazing.  How this game was once massive is beyond me.  But it's a well-made game, I guess, and loads of people enjoy it.  Just not my thing.

One of the original multiplayer FPS games, and still one of the best.  Great team play, thousands of active servers any time of the day or night, a thriving map-making community, and all-around great fun.

Pros:  The game is fun, works well on most hardware and older machines, loads quickly, allows for numerous mods, does not burden your bandwidth (I can play on my measly 1/2 Mbps connection, one of the largest active multiplayer communities.

Cons: Could use more game modes, teamwork is hit or miss (it's a great thing when you find a server where people work together), time sink.  :)

Popular Review: "A fantastic conversion of a timeless classic and it has stolen the hearts of the online community once again." - Xequted

My Review: It's the one of the best fast-paced, tactical, and teamwork-based game you can play. The funniest out there and imho better than its predecessor. The maps, guns, models, and gameplay are amazing. And if playing the standard way is not your thing, there is a wide variety of custom maps and game types (zombie mod, jail break, hide and seek, surfing, etc.)

Counter-Strike: Source is pretty much the classic Counter-Strike we all know and love/hate, only now in the Source engine. Being on a different engine, there are new ways to play: for example, grenades now bounce from the walls in a more "realistic" way, but more or less it's the same game as always.

This game also includes bots, for solo play, if that's what you like, and it has several classic maps from the original CS. As always, it's easy to pick up, difficult to master.
Those who want a heavy competitve, classic First Person Shooter experience should buy this game!
